text: what's up everyone in today's video I'm

asked on my Instagram stories today so
let's jump right into it
what is your plan after visiting all the
countries alright this is a question
I've been getting the most lately what
is my plan when I finish all the
countries to be honest I'm probably
going to cut back on the daily videos
and I'm probably going to go into more
longer form content I'm also working on
a really exciting documentary which I
will tell you guys more details about

Wisconsin for school and then been
living in Asia ever since South Korea
Vietnam Thailand Philippines and in

to go every night it just sort of become
my lifestyle and I haven't really
thought of it like that it's amazing I
really love what I do I'm really
passionate about it and never really
bothers me that I'm sleeping in
different beds different hotels
different couches different hostiles it
doesn't really matter to me 105 bucks a
night in Djibouti this is what you get
I'm just addicted to the thrill of going

making these stories for you guys all to
watch which country in your next trip

Eritrea and Ghana how do you get the

and that perfectly applies to me I'm

it's just an amazing incredible

typically like to stay positive and I
don't like to dwell on the negatives but
the single scariest moment of my life
was in
I was in a bus crash an overnight bus
crash two people didn't survive on the
bus I was stranded in the middle of the
desert and it was just a horrible

man this is hard whenever people ask me

ready
but in Vietnam Pad Thai in Thailand

how could a person travel many countries

there are plenty ways to travel cheaply
couchsurfing number one for free
accommodations instead of eating out go

go for it I've only done it a few times

there are many ways to travel on the
cheap if you're going to cut back on

just do by yourself how do you afford
your travels okay here's the money
question everyone get
so when I started traveling in 2013 I
was teaching English in South Korea for
two years I made about thirty-five
thousand US dollars a year and I also

paid vacation and a yearly bonus and
that was enough for me to live nicely
like a king in Korea I started my travel

it wasn't really until like two years

sometimes they go to the nicest 5-star

nobody feeling in the world than hitting

it's the best sport on this planet how
